entry.title: A Post Quantum Migration Proposal
entry.summary: The discussion emphasizes the importance of basing restrictions on the cryptographic operations required for spending cryptocurrencies rather than broadly on the output script type. Particularly, it highlights the scenario with P2QRH (Pay to Quantum Resistant Hash), suggesting an optimal approach where users include a leaf script in their transactions that is capable of supporting post-quantum opcodes. This preparation would facilitate future transitions to post-quantum cryptography through a simple software update, thereby ensuring the security and ease of cryptocurrency transactions in the face of quantum computing advancements. This strategy underscores the proactive measures in cryptographic design to accommodate future technological shifts, specifically in the context of Bitcoin development.
